text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement ernest@guevarra.io. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. title: Semi-Quantitative Evaluation of Access and Coverage
text: squeacr package provides functions facilitate processing, analysis reporting various components SQUEAC investigation. current version squeacr package currently provides following: Functions calculate CMAM programme performance metrics; Functions calculate CMAM programme length stay metrics; , Functions calculate CMAM coverage estimates.

title: Semi-Quantitative Evaluation of Access and Coverage
text: squeacr package yet available CRAN can installed nutriverse R Universe follows:
code: install.packages(   "squeacr",   repos = c('https://nutriverse.r-universe.dev', 'https://cloud.r-project.org') )

title: Semi-Quantitative Evaluation of Access and Coverage
text: Cure rate, defaulter rate, death rate, non-response rate programme indicators used monitor performance CMAM. indicators calculated routine programme monitoring data, example monitoring dataset included squeacr. CMAM programme monitoring data Sudan (showing first 15 rows) monitoring dataset National CMAM programme Sudan showing monthly programme statistics per locality. dataset following fields: can calculate different programme performance indicators using squeacr. example, ’ll calculate indicators state per year. results following:
code: library(squeacr) library(dplyr)  monitoring |>   group_by(State, Year) |>   summarise(     total_discharge = sum(`Total Discharge`, na.rm = TRUE),     cure_rate = calculate_cured(sum(Cured, na.rm = TRUE), total_discharge),     default_rate = calculate_default(sum(Default, na.rm = TRUE), total_discharge),     death_rate = calculate_dead(sum(Death, na.rm = TRUE), total_discharge),     non_response_rate = calculate_no_response(sum(`Non-Responder`, na.rm = TRUE), total_discharge),     .groups = "drop"   ) #> # A tibble: 72 × 7 #>    State          Year  total_discharge cure_rate default_rate death_rate #>    <chr>          <chr>           <dbl>     <dbl>        <dbl>      <dbl> #>  1 Blue Nile      2016             9693     0.889       0.0906    0.0151  #>  2 Blue Nile      2017            10286     0.948       0.0399    0.00972 #>  3 Blue Nile      2018             8807     0.947       0.0404    0.00863 #>  4 Blue Nile      2019             9882     0.953       0.0366    0.00708 #>  5 Central Darfur 2016            13313     0.921       0.0440    0.0174  #>  6 Central Darfur 2017            18098     0.935       0.0421    0.00912 #>  7 Central Darfur 2018            17600     0.939       0.0364    0.00955 #>  8 Central Darfur 2019            18573     0.952       0.0260    0.00549 #>  9 East Darfur    2016             9895     0.929       0.0550    0.0104  #> 10 East Darfur    2017            12611     0.956       0.0327    0.00690 #> # ℹ 62 more rows #> # ℹ 1 more variable: non_response_rate <dbl>

title: Semi-Quantitative Evaluation of Access and Coverage
text: squeacr provides functions calculate programme coverage. functions implement single coverage estimator approach1. approach, treatment coverage calculated way estimates number severe acute malnutrition (SAM) cases enrolled programme recovering without treatment (r_out). example, coverage survey yielded 5 SAM cases programme, 25 cases programme, 5 recovering cases programme, r_out can calculated follows: Note calculate_rout() function another argument named k correction factor representing ratio mean length untreated episode mean length CMAM treatment episode. , default, set k = 3 function. However, adjusted based programme data estimate mean length SAM treatment episode. calculation r_out used within calculate_tc() estimate treatment coverage:
code: calculate_rout(cin = 5, cout = 25, rin = 5) #> [1] 6 calculate_tc(cin = 5, cout = 25, rin = 5) #> [1] 0.2439024

what: Semi-Quantitative Evaluation of Access and Coverage (SQUEAC) Tools
title: Semi-Quantitative Evaluation of Access and Coverage (SQUEAC) Tools
text: recent past, measurement community-based management acute malnutrition (CMAM) programme coverage mainly two-stage cluster sampled surveys either part nutrition assessment specific coverage survey known Centric Systematic Area Sampling (CSAS). However, methods resource intensive often used final programme evaluation meaning results arrive late programme adaptation. SQUEAC, stands Semi-Quantitative Evaluation Access Coverage, low resource method designed specifically address limitation used regularly monitoring, planning importantly, timely improvement programme quality, agency Ministry Health (MoH) led programmes. package provides functions use conducting SQUEAC investigation.

Can single date value vector date values. group character value/s length admission_date discharge_data use grouping variable within median length--stay calculated. Default NULL grouping.

title: Calculate CMAM performance indicators — calculate_performance
text: Calculate CMAM performance indicators

title: Calculate CMAM performance indicators — calculate_performance
code: calculate_performance(df, vars = NULL, add = TRUE)  calculate_cured(cured, exit)  calculate_dead(dead, exit)  calculate_default(defaulter, exit)  calculate_no_response(nr, exit)

title: Calculate CMAM performance indicators — calculate_performance
text: df data.frame containing programme monitoring data number cured, deaths, defaulters non-response. required data.frame holds rows data corresponding total counts performance indicator (.e., cured, dead, defaulter non-responder) rather rows individual cases. vars vector variable names specifying cured, dead, defaulter non-responder (specific order) values df. NULL (default), typical names used variables searched used accordingly. search yield matching variable names, first 4 columns data.frame used. add Logical. result added df. Default TRUE. cured Numeric value total number cured cases exit Numeric value total number programme exits dead Numeric value total number cases died defaulter Numeric value total number cases defaulted nr Numeric value total number cases respond

title: Calculate CMAM performance indicators — calculate_performance
text: tibble performance indicator results (calculate_performance()) numeric value specified CMAM performance indicator (calculate_cured(), calculate_default(), calculate_dead()), calculate_no_response().

what: Semi-Quantitative Evaluation of Access and Coverage (SQUEAC) Tools — squeacr
title: Semi-Quantitative Evaluation of Access and Coverage (SQUEAC) Tools — squeacr
text: recent past, measurement coverage mainly two-stage cluster sampled surveys either part nutrition assessment specific coverage survey known Centric Systematic Area Sampling (CSAS). However, methods resource intensive often used final programme evaluation meaning results arrive late programme adaptation. SQUEAC, stands Semi-Quantitative Evaluation Access Coverage, low resource method designed specifically address limitation used regularly monitoring, planning importantly, timely improvement programme quality, agency Ministry Health (MoH) led programmes. package provides functions use conducting SQUEAC investigation.

title: Semi-Quantitative Evaluation of Access and Coverage (SQUEAC) Tools — squeacr
text: Myatt, Mark et al. 2012. Semi-Quantitative Evaluation Access Coverage (SQUEAC)/Simplified Lot Quality Assurance Sampling Evaluation Access Coverage (SLEAC) Technical Reference. Washington, DC: FHI 360/FANTA.
